flawed_nl_solution:
There are 60 students because 8 x 15 = <<8*15=60>>60
90% of the lunchroom is boys because 100 - 40 = <<100-40=90>>90
There are 54 boys because 60 x .{percent_boys/percent_total} = <<60*.{percent_boys/percent_total}=54>>54
There are 24 girls because 60 x .{percent_girls/percent_total} = <<60*.{percent_girls/percent_total}=24>>24
The boys drink 54 cartons of milk because 54 x 1 = <<54*1=54>>54
The girls drink 48 cartons of milk because 24 x 2 = <<24*2=48>>48
They drink 102 cartons of milk because 54 + 48 = <<54+48=102>>102

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 90. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
